body:
Interesting!

If I try to download the link you sent me then Canel is the only option I get.

I can't do anything about onedrive thinking the file is a threat, so I guess the question is, is there anything in the API which could say "I'm OK with downloading a file which might contain viruses" and allow rclone to download the file.

Onedrive has a `virusSuspicious` error code which you can see here: https://dev.onedrive.com/misc/errors.htm but it doesn't look like it is returning that from the log.

That is the only mention of the word virus in the API docs.

When you try to download the file through the browser and you click OK, can you see what file your browser actually downloads? I'd do this with the [chrome devtools](https://developer.chrome.com/devtools) and the network tab.  Most browsers have something similar now-a-days.  I'm just wondering if there is a `?acknowledgeVirus=true` flag or something.

Hi ncw, this is the flow when I download the file, I think the magic query parameter is AVOverride=1
File on my server: http://darkvater.homenet.org/DBGT-html.tar.bz2
1. I click on download on OneDrive:
   - Url: https://onedrive.live.com/download.aspx
   - Response Code: 302 (Found)
   - Query String Parameters:
     - cid:[some-cid]
     - resid:[some-cid]!48942
     - canary:ublwZ/2y043MfQibrrX+RlfVzLDRIHNx6JElwS8puSQ=7
     - ithint:.bz2
2. I get forwarded to:
   - Url: https://uagowq-ch3301.files.1drv.com/.../DBGT-html.tar.bz2
   - Response Code: 302 (Found)
   - Response headers: X-Virus-Infected:ScanError
   - Query String Parameters:
     - download:
     - psid:1
3. I get forwarded to - again:
   - Url: https://skydrive.live.com/redir.aspx
   - Response Code: 200 (OK)
   - Query String Parameters:
     - resid[some-cid]!48942
     - avres:ScanError
     - averror:DAMAGED_STREAM
     - page:viruswarning
4. Browser tries to download:
   - Url: https://onedrive.live.com/viruswarning.aspx/Pictures/DBGT-html.tar.bz2
   - Response Code: 403 (Forbidden)
   - Query String Parameters:
     - resid:[some-cid]!48942
     - avres:ScanError
     - averror:DAMAGED_STREAM
     - page:viruswarning
5. I get confirmation request, I actually click to download and accept warning:
   - Url: https://uagowq-ch3301.files.1drv.com/.../DBGT-html.tar.bz2
   - Response Code: 200 (OK)
   - Query String Parameters:
     - download:
     - psid:1
     - **AVOverride:1**

rename.to: [onedrive] 403 forbidden on some files - try AVOverride

issue.title: Add option to use AVOverride=1
issue.body:
See https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/557

It's an option to override the virus checking on downloads

body:
Was this issue ever resolved?

```
2020/09/06 02:11:29 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 3 errors and: failed to open source object: 403 Forbidden:
2020/09/06 02:11:29 Failed to sync with 3 errors: last error was: failed to open source object: 403 Forbidden:
```
We never implement the avoverride flag - do you want to have a go @paz ?
@Darkvater @paz Does the problem reproduce with rclone 1.54?
the problem randomly disappeaared for me on 1.53.3, not sure why. maybe onedrive stopped deciding the file was a virus

This is reoccurring for me on rclone v1.60.1

A "good" way to reproduce this is:

Download https://www.nirsoft.net/utils/produkey-x64.zip and upload it to OneDrive (https://www.virustotal.com/gui/url/22d3d4791b9a9fc01bd848d418d01dce2cb1560a3d72b2a6631485c0c5abf307)
Hit this again, can this be reopened @ivandeex?

@voltagex do you want to implement the `AVOverride=1` flag?

Something like this should do for a proof of concept

```patch
--- a/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go
+++ b/backend/onedrive/onedrive.go
@@ -1966,6 +1966,7 @@ func (o *Object) Open(ctx context.Context, options ...fs.OpenOption) (in io.Read
 	var resp *http.Response
 	opts := o.fs.newOptsCall(o.id, "GET", "/content")
 	opts.Options = options
+	opts.Parameters = url.Values{"AVOverride": {"1"}}
 
 	err = o.fs.pacer.Call(func() (bool, error) {
 		resp, err = o.fs.srv.Call(ctx, &opts)
```

Then it would need to be configured with a flag if that works.
